intro: Linaria elegans var. kralikiana, commonly known as the Kralikiana toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow-orange flowers in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its bright, showy blooms.
